title: A Big Country: The Legend of Jimmy Governor
viewing_guidelines: Aboriginal and Islander viewers should note this work may contain images of deceased people and caution should be exercised when viewing.
subject_group: Aboriginal Australia/Aboriginal Australians in motion pictures
abstract: Episode of ABC TV series 'A Big Country' exploring  the real life story of Jimmy Governor, as compared to his fictional counterpart, Jimmie Blacksmith.
description: Episode of ABC TV series 'A Big Country' exploring  the real life story of Jimmy Governor, as compared to his fictional counterpart, Jimmie Blacksmith, in the novel and film, 'The Chant of Jimmie Blacksmith'. Includes interviews with author, Thomas Keneally, and film director, Fred Schepisi, on location during the making of the film. Broadcast on ABC TV in April 1978. Reporter: Kenyon Castle. Narrator: Bob Plasto.
related_objects: Title; 301739; The Chant of Jimmie Blacksmith; Active; 1978
